thread.title: Karen Matthews prison letters to friend Julie Bushby expose her as obsessed with CDs and clothes - and she doesn't mention her kids ONCE
thread.title_full: Karen Matthews prison letters to friend Julie Bushby expose her as obsessed with CDs and clothes - and she doesn't mention her kids ONCE

author: Lucy Buckland
title: Karen Matthews prison letters to friend Julie Bushby expose her as obsessed with CDs and clothes - and she doesn't mention her kids ONCE
text:
Watch: Police interrogation of Karen Matthews Share this video Watch Next 
"I hope I will never lose you has a friend because it would break my heart. When you get enough to buy me a cd can get me UB40 Labour of Love please. 
"You might get cheap ones from Asda or Tesco." 
She adds: "I am doing well in my job and being strong and can't wait to see you my friend has been supportive through the sad news you told me about my brother. I hope to see you soon mate. I like this top." 
Karen then stuck a picture of a cheap £12 jumper onto the letter and adorned the envelope with childish drawings of trees and faces. 
Julie has told how she was busy ironing when she was told by a neighbour: “ Karen ’s eldest girl’s gone missing.” Read More Karen Matthews faked the kidnap of her own daughter (Photo: West Yorkshire Police/PA) Karen Matthews last year (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
It was about 6.30pm on February 19, 2008, when mum-of-three Julie, chairman of the local residents’ association, was asked to bring the keys to open the community house. 
Within an hour, around a hundred people from the 220 houses on the Moorside estate had arrived to help - all ready to start the search. 
They walked the streets in freezing conditions until the early hours of the morning shouting, “ Shannon ” and searching derelict buildings. 
Pensioners who were too frail to search brought tea and coffee. Read More
